title: Psalms Chapter 33 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Psalms chapter 33 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Psalms Chapter 33 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Psalms Chapter 33.

questions.question: According to Psalms 33:1, who are called to rejoice in the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: The righteous
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:1 states, 'Rejoice in the LORD, O ye righteous,' calling the righteous to rejoice.

questions.question: What musical instruments are mentioned in Psalms 33:2 for praising the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Harp and psaltery
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:2 says to 'Praise the LORD with harp: sing unto him with the psaltery and an instrument of ten strings.'

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Psalms 33:3: 'Sing unto him a ______ song; play skilfully with a loud noise.'
questions.correctAnswer: new
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:3 instructs to 'Sing unto him a new song,' emphasizing fresh praise.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 33:4 says that all the works of the LORD are done in truth.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:4 states, 'For the word of the LORD is right; and all his works are done in truth.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 33:5, what does the LORD love?
questions.correctAnswer: Righteousness and judgment
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:5 says, 'He loveth righteousness and judgment.'

questions.question: How were the heavens made according to Psalms 33:6?
options: By the word of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: By the word of the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:6 states, 'By the word of the LORD were the heavens made.'

questions.question: What does the LORD do with the waters of the sea according to Psalms 33:7?
options: Gathers them together as a heap
questions.correctAnswer: Gathers them together as a heap
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:7 says, 'He gathereth the waters of the sea together as an heap.'

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 33:8 calls for all the earth and inhabitants of the world to fear and stand in awe of the LORD.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:8 instructs, 'Let all the earth fear the LORD: let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.'

questions.question: What happened when the LORD spoke according to Psalms 33:9?
questions.correctAnswer: It was done
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:9 states, 'For he spake, and it was done; he commanded, and it stood fast.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 33:10, what does the LORD do to the counsel of the heathen?
questions.correctAnswer: Brings it to nought
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:10 says, 'The LORD bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought.'

questions.question: Whose counsel stands forever according to Psalms 33:11?
questions.correctAnswer: The counsel of the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:11 states, 'The counsel of the LORD standeth for ever.'

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 33:12 says a nation is blessed if its God is the LORD.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:12 says, 'Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD.'

questions.question: Where does the LORD look from according to Psalms 33:13?
questions.correctAnswer: From heaven
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:13 says, 'The LORD looketh from heaven.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 33:16, can a king be saved by the multitude of an host?
questions.correctAnswer: No
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:16 states, 'There is no king saved by the multitude of an host.'

questions.question: What does Psalms 33:18 say about the eye of the LORD?
options: It is upon them that fear him
questions.correctAnswer: It is upon them that fear him
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:18 says, 'Behold, the eye of the LORD is upon them that fear him.'

medium.title: Psalms Chapter 33 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Psalms Chapter 33 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is feeling overwhelmed by the challenges of life and wonders how to find true security. Based on Psalms 33, what biblical truth would you share about where true safety is found?
options: In trusting the Lord as our help and shield
In having a large army or strong horses
In relying on human wisdom and counsel
questions.correctAnswer: In trusting the Lord as our help and shield
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:16-20 teaches that no king or mighty man is saved by their strength or armies, and horses do not bring safety. Instead, our soul waits for the LORD who is our help and shield, emphasizing trust in God as our true security (verses 16-20).

questions.question: How does Psalms 33 teach us about the importance of praising God in our personal devotion and spiritual discipline?
options: By encouraging rejoicing and singing skillfully with instruments
By suggesting silence and meditation without words
By focusing only on solemn prayers without music
By avoiding public expressions of worship
questions.correctAnswer: By encouraging rejoicing and singing skillfully with instruments
questions.explanation: Verses 1-3 encourage the righteous to rejoice in the LORD, praise Him with harp and psaltery, and sing a new song skillfully. This highlights the biblical practice of worship through joyful music and praise as part of spiritual discipline (Psalms 33:1-3).

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to trust God's plan amidst confusion. According to Psalms 33, what truth about God's counsel can provide assurance?
options: The counsel of the LORD stands forever and His thoughts endure to all generations
Human plans are always more reliable than God's
God changes His mind frequently based on circumstances
The plans of the people are more powerful than God's counsel
questions.correctAnswer: The counsel of the LORD stands forever and His thoughts endure to all generations
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:10-11 states that God brings the counsel of the heathen to nothing, but the counsel of the LORD stands forever, giving assurance that His plans are unchanging and trustworthy.

questions.question: In what way does Psalms 33 encourage us to live with integrity and uprightness in our daily work and relationships?
options: Praise is comely for the upright, and God loves righteousness and judgment
Success depends mainly on cleverness and manipulation
Honesty is less important than results
Uprightness is only necessary in religious settings
questions.correctAnswer: Praise is comely for the upright, and God loves righteousness and judgment
questions.explanation: Verses 1 and 5 emphasize that praise is fitting for the upright and that God loves righteousness and judgment, encouraging believers to pursue integrity and fairness in all areas of life (Psalms 33:1,5).

questions.question: A person wonders how God is involved in creation and governance of the world. What does Psalms 33 teach about God's power and sovereignty?
options: God made the heavens by His word and sustains all by His breath
The world was created by chance without purpose
God needs human help to govern the earth
Creation is independent of God's will
questions.correctAnswer: God made the heavens by His word and sustains all by His breath
questions.explanation: Verses 6-7 describe how by the word of the LORD the heavens were made and all the host by the breath of His mouth, showing divine power and sovereign control over creation (Psalms 33:6-7).

questions.question: What does Psalms 33 teach about how God views all people, and how should this affect our attitude towards others?
options: God fashions their hearts alike and considers all their works
God only cares for the righteous and ignores others
questions.correctAnswer: God fashions their hearts alike and considers all their works
questions.explanation: Verses 13-15 tell us that the LORD looks from heaven and fashions the hearts of all alike, considering all their works, which calls believers to humility and fairness in how they treat others (Psalms 33:13-15).

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 33, God’s mercy is available to those who fear Him and hope in His mercy.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:18-19 states that the eye of the LORD is upon those who fear Him and hope in His mercy, showing that God's mercy is available to such people.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 33 teaches that human strength and military power are sufficient to save a king or mighty man.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:16-17 clearly states that no king is saved by the multitude of an host, nor is a mighty man delivered by great strength or horses, highlighting that human power alone is insufficient.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Blessed is the nation whose God is the _____; and the people whom he hath chosen for his own inheritance.'
questions.correctAnswer: LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:12 teaches that the blessing comes to the nation whose God is the LORD, emphasizing the importance of national faithfulness to God.

questions.question: How does Psalms 33 instruct believers on maintaining hope and joy amidst trials?
options: By waiting for the LORD and rejoicing in His holy name
By relying solely on their own strength
By avoiding faith during difficult times
questions.correctAnswer: By waiting for the LORD and rejoicing in His holy name
questions.explanation: Verses 20-21 encourage the soul to wait for the LORD who is our help and shield, and for our heart to rejoice because we trust in His holy name, teaching hopeful perseverance through faith (Psalms 33:20-21).

questions.question: A believer is struggling with the desire to control their future. What biblical truth from Psalms 33 would you share about God's control over human plans?
options: The LORD brings the counsel of the heathen to nothing and defeats people's devices
Human plans always succeed without God's involvement
God ignores the schemes of people
People's plans are more powerful than God's
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD brings the counsel of the heathen to nothing and defeats people's devices
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:10 emphasizes that God frustrates the plans of the nations and makes their devices ineffective, teaching that ultimately God's sovereign will prevails.

questions.question: How does Psalms 33 encourage believers to respond in prayer regarding God's mercy?
options: To ask that God's mercy be upon us according to our hope in Him
To seek mercy based on our own works
questions.correctAnswer: To ask that God's mercy be upon us according to our hope in Him
questions.explanation: Verse 22 expresses a prayer asking the LORD's mercy upon us as we hope in Him, demonstrating the importance of hopeful dependence on God's mercy in prayer (Psalms 33:22).

questions.question: What does Psalms 33 teach about God's justice and righteousness in relation to the earth?
options: God loves righteousness and judgment, and the earth is full of His goodness
God ignores justice and only focuses on power
The earth is ruled by human fairness alone
Justice is a human invention, not God's concern
questions.correctAnswer: God loves righteousness and judgment, and the earth is full of His goodness
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:5 states that God loves righteousness and judgment, and that the earth is full of the goodness of the LORD, underscoring God's active role in justice and goodness.

questions.question: How should a believer view God’s observation of human actions according to Psalms 33?
options: God looks from heaven and considers all the hearts and works of men
God is indifferent to human behavior
God is unaware of human deeds
questions.correctAnswer: God looks from heaven and considers all the hearts and works of men
questions.explanation: Verses 13-15 explain that the LORD looks down from heaven, beholding all people, fashioning their hearts alike and considering all their works, encouraging believers to live with integrity (Psalms 33:13-15).

questions.question: A believer is seeking encouragement to share new songs of praise in worship. What does Psalms 33 say about this practice?
options: Sing unto Him a new song and play skillfully with a loud noise
questions.correctAnswer: Sing unto Him a new song and play skillfully with a loud noise
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:3 encourages singing a new song and skillful playing with instruments, promoting joyful and creative praise in worship.

hard.title: Psalms Chapter 33 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Psalms Chapter 33.

questions.question: What instruments are mentioned in Psalms 33:2 for praising the LORD?
options: Harp, psaltery, and an instrument of ten strings
questions.correctAnswer: Harp, psaltery, and an instrument of ten strings
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:2 specifically mentions praising the LORD with harp, singing with the psaltery, and an instrument of ten strings.

questions.question: According to Psalms 33:4, what characterizes the word of the LORD?
options: It is right and all His works are done in truth
It is mysterious and hard to understand
It is conditional on human actions
questions.correctAnswer: It is right and all His works are done in truth
questions.explanation: Verse 4 emphasizes the righteousness of God's word and the truthfulness of all His works, highlighting divine integrity.

questions.question: In Psalms 33:6, what is said to have been created by the word of the LORD?
options: The heavens and all the host of them
questions.correctAnswer: The heavens and all the host of them
questions.explanation: This verse attributes the creation of the heavens and their hosts to the word of the LORD, underscoring divine sovereignty over creation.

questions.question: Which verse in Psalms 33 highlights that God’s counsel stands forever and His thoughts extend to all generations?
questions.correctAnswer: Psalms 33:11
questions.explanation: Verse 11 declares the eternal nature of the LORD’s counsel and the enduring scope of His thoughts, reflecting divine omniscience and providence.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Blessed is the nation whose God is the ___; and the people whom he hath chosen for his own inheritance.'
questions.correctAnswer: LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:12 identifies the LORD as the God of the blessed nation and their inheritance, emphasizing covenant relationship.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 33:18 states that the eye of the LORD is upon all people regardless of their fear or hope.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The verse specifies that God's eye is upon those who fear Him and hope in His mercy, indicating conditional divine attention.

questions.question: What does Psalms 33:9 illustrate about the power of God's word?
options: He spoke and it was done; He commanded and it stood fast
He whispered and the earth trembled
He sang and the heavens rejoiced
He wrote and the laws were established
questions.correctAnswer: He spoke and it was done; He commanded and it stood fast
questions.explanation: This verse highlights God’s sovereign power in creation and providence by the effectiveness of His spoken word.

questions.question: According to Psalms 33:16, why is a king not saved by the multitude of his host?
options: Because salvation depends on the LORD, not on military strength
Because kings are always defeated in battle
Because wise counsel is more important than numbers
questions.correctAnswer: Because salvation depends on the LORD, not on military strength
questions.explanation: This verse reflects a theological principle that human power and numbers cannot guarantee salvation, which depends on God.

questions.question: Which literary device is evident in Psalms 33:6-7 where creation is described by the word and breath of God?
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: Verses 6 and 7 use synonymous parallelism to emphasize God’s creative power through word and breath, a common Hebrew poetic device.

questions.question: What is the significance of God's 'breath' in the creation account in Psalms 33:6 compared to Genesis 2:7?
options: It refers to the wind only
It is a poetic metaphor for noise
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes life-giving power
questions.explanation: Both Psalms 33:6 and Genesis 2:7 use breath to denote the divine power that animates and sustains creation.

questions.question: Who does Psalms 33:15 say God 'fashioneth their hearts alike' and 'considereth all their works'?
questions.correctAnswer: All men
questions.explanation: The verse expresses God's sovereign and impartial knowledge of all humanity's inner being and actions.

questions.question: According to Psalms 33:10, what does the LORD do to the counsel of the heathen?
options: Brings it to nought and makes devices of people of none effect
questions.correctAnswer: Brings it to nought and makes devices of people of none effect
questions.explanation: This verse shows God's supreme authority over human plans, nullifying those contrary to His will.

questions.question: Which New Testament passage echoes the theme of God's word creating all things as in Psalms 33:6?
questions.correctAnswer: John 1:1-3
questions.explanation: John 1:1-3 parallels Psalms 33:6 by affirming that all things were made through the Word, emphasizing Christ's role in creation.

questions.question: What hope is described in Psalms 33:19 for those who fear the LORD?
options: Deliverance from death and preservation in famine
questions.correctAnswer: Deliverance from death and preservation in famine
questions.explanation: This verse assures the faithful of God's mercy and protection even in dire circumstances.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 33 calls the horse a reliable source of safety and deliverance.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:17 states that the horse is a vain thing for safety and cannot deliver by its great strength, emphasizing reliance on God over military power.

theological.title: Psalms Chapter 33 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Psalms Chapter 33 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Psalms 33, what is the fundamental reason given for rejoicing and praising the LORD?
options: Because praise is comely for the upright
Because the LORD rewards the faithful
questions.correctAnswer: Because praise is comely for the upright
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:1 calls the righteous to rejoice and praises God because such praise is fitting or comely for the upright. This aligns with other scriptures like Psalm 97:12, Philippians 4:4, Romans 12:1, and Hebrews 13:15, emphasizing that praise is an appropriate response to God's holiness and righteousness.

questions.question: What instruments are mentioned in Psalms 33 for praising the LORD?
options: Harp, psaltery, and an instrument of ten strings
questions.correctAnswer: Harp, psaltery, and an instrument of ten strings
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:2 explicitly mentions praising the LORD with harp, singing with the psaltery, and an instrument of ten strings. This reflects the biblical tradition of using music and various instruments in worship, as also seen in 1 Chronicles 15:16, 2 Samuel 6:5, Ezra 3:10, and Psalm 150:3-5.

questions.question: What is declared about the word of the LORD in Psalms 33?
options: The word of the LORD is right and all His works are done in truth
The word of the LORD is sometimes mysterious
The word of the LORD is only for the righteous
The word of the LORD is hidden from many
questions.correctAnswer: The word of the LORD is right and all His works are done in truth
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:4 affirms that the word of the LORD is right, and all His works are done in truth, emphasizing God's perfect righteousness and faithfulness. This is consistent with 2 Samuel 7:28, Psalm 119:160, Isaiah 40:8, and John 17:17, which highlight God's Word as reliable and true.

questions.question: How does Psalms 33 describe God's attitude toward righteousness and judgment?
options: He only favors mercy over judgment
questions.correctAnswer: He loves righteousness and judgment
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:5 states that God loves righteousness and judgment, showing His commitment to justice and moral order. This is supported by passages like Psalm 11:7, Proverbs 21:3, Isaiah 61:8, and Romans 3:26, which assert God's love for justice alongside mercy.

questions.question: What role does the word of the LORD play in creation according to Psalms 33?
options: The heavens and their host were made by the word of the LORD
Creation was formed by human wisdom
The earth was created by angels
Creation is unexplainable by divine word
questions.correctAnswer: The heavens and their host were made by the word of the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:6 teaches that the heavens and all their hosts were created by the word of the LORD and the breath of His mouth. This doctrine aligns with Genesis 1:1, Hebrews 11:3, John 1:3, and Colossians 1:16, which affirm God's sovereign creative power through His word.

questions.question: What does Psalms 33 say about God's control over the waters of the sea?
options: He gathers the waters as a heap and lays up the depths in storehouses
The waters of the sea are uncontrollable
The sea is a symbol of chaos beyond God's power
Humans can control the sea by wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: He gathers the waters as a heap and lays up the depths in storehouses
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:7 describes God's sovereign control over the seas, gathering the waters as a heap and storing the depths, reflecting His dominion over chaos. This is consistent with Job 38:8-11, Isaiah 51:10, Jeremiah 5:22, and Nahum 1:4, which depict God as master over the waters.

questions.question: What does Psalms 33 teach about the LORD's sovereignty over human plans?
options: The LORD brings the counsel of the heathen to nothing and frustrates the devices of the people
Human plans always succeed without God's involvement
God ignores the plans of nations
The LORD supports all human designs
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD brings the counsel of the heathen to nothing and frustrates the devices of the people
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:10 highlights God's sovereignty by stating He nullifies the counsel of the heathen and makes the devices of people ineffective. This theme is echoed in Proverbs 19:21, Daniel 4:35, Isaiah 14:27, and James 4:13-15, emphasizing God's ultimate control over human affairs.

questions.question: How is the permanence of God's counsel described in Psalms 33?
options: The counsel of the LORD stands forever; the thoughts of His heart to all generations
God's counsel is temporary and changes often
God has no counsel for humanity
Human counsel is more enduring than God's
questions.correctAnswer: The counsel of the LORD stands forever; the thoughts of His heart to all generations
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:11 declares the eternal and unchanging nature of God's counsel and thoughts. This mirrors Isaiah 40:8, Psalm 119:89, Romans 11:29, and Hebrews 13:8, affirming God's faithfulness and constancy through all generations.

questions.question: What blessing is pronounced on a nation in Psalms 33?
options: Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD
Blessed is the nation with the strongest army
Blessed is the nation with the most wealth
Blessed is the nation that trusts in itself
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:12 pronounces blessing on nations whose God is the LORD, emphasizing divine favor upon those who covenantally trust Him. This is supported by Deuteronomy 28:1-14, Jeremiah 18:7-10, 2 Chronicles 7:14, and Matthew 6:33, which teach God's blessing on faithful nations and peoples.

questions.question: From where does the LORD look upon the sons of men according to Psalms 33?
options: From the earth, among the nations
From the clouds only during judgment
questions.correctAnswer: From heaven, His habitation
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:13-14 state that the LORD looks from heaven, His dwelling place, upon all humanity. This divine omniscience and omnipresence is similarly portrayed in 1 Kings 8:27, Psalm 113:4-6, Jeremiah 23:24, and Acts 17:27-28, affirming God's sovereign oversight.

questions.question: How does Psalms 33 describe God's knowledge of human hearts and works?
options: He fashions their hearts alike and considers all their works
He ignores human intentions and focuses on actions only
He judges based on appearances only
He is unaware of the inner thoughts of men
questions.correctAnswer: He fashions their hearts alike and considers all their works
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:15 emphasizes that God forms human hearts equally and examines all their deeds, underscoring His intimate knowledge of human nature. This truth is echoed in Jeremiah 17:10, 1 Samuel 16:7, Hebrews 4:13, and Proverbs 21:2.

questions.question: What does Psalms 33 say about reliance on human strength or military might for salvation?
options: No king is saved by the multitude of an host, nor a mighty man by great strength
Kings are always saved by their armies
Mighty men deliver themselves by their strength
Military power guarantees victory and salvation
questions.correctAnswer: No king is saved by the multitude of an host, nor a mighty man by great strength
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:16-17 teaches that human power, including armies and strong men, cannot save, highlighting dependence on God alone. This doctrine is supported by Exodus 15:6, Psalm 20:7, Isaiah 31:1, and Zechariah 4:6, all emphasizing God's deliverance over human might.

questions.question: On whom does the eye of the LORD rest according to Psalms 33?
options: On those who fear Him and hope in His mercy
On those who trust in horses and chariots
On the wealthy and powerful only
questions.correctAnswer: On those who fear Him and hope in His mercy
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:18 states that the LORD’s eye is upon those who fear Him and place their hope in His mercy. This theme is found in Psalm 34:15, Proverbs 15:3, Lamentations 3:25, and Hebrews 11:6, highlighting God's care for the humble and trusting.

questions.question: What is the purpose of God's watchful eye on those who fear Him, as described in Psalms 33?
options: To deliver their soul from death and keep them alive in famine
To punish them for their sins
To test them without providing help
questions.correctAnswer: To deliver their soul from death and keep them alive in famine
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:19 explains that God's watchful care aims to deliver and preserve His people, especially in times of death and famine. This assurance is consistent with Psalm 91:3, Isaiah 43:2, Matthew 6:25-34, and 2 Corinthians 12:9.

questions.question: What is the attitude of the psalmist's soul toward the LORD in Psalms 33?
options: Our soul waits for the LORD as our help and shield
Our soul doubts the LORD's protection
Our soul relies on human strength
Our soul turns away from the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Our soul waits for the LORD as our help and shield
questions.explanation: Psalms 33:20 expresses patient waiting and trust in the LORD as a protector and helper. This reflects biblical teachings in Lamentations 3:25-26, Psalm 62:5-7, Isaiah 40:31, and Romans 8:28 about trusting God's providence and protection.
